newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks sees revenue growth in FY98.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks sees revenue growth in FY98.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc Chief Financial Officer David Rynne said Tuesday the company expects revenues to begin rising again in fiscal 1998 following flat revenues in fiscal 1997.
Rynne declined to say by how much he saw revenues growing.
Following a presentation at a Hambrecht & Quist investor conference here, he told Reuters that revenue growth will be spurred by Bay's new Internet switching product, SwitchNode.
Rynne called SwitchNode "the most fundamentally important switch for the future" of Bay. "It will become dramatically more important in the next generation of switching," he said.
Shares of Bay were up one point at 17-1/2 at midday.
Through three quarters of fiscal 1997, ended March 31, Bay revenues had risen to $1.55 bln from $1.52 billion a year earlier.
